comments:
My steps:
1. Created a Java project "Java"
2. Created a type in the default package named "Hello" in Java
3. Created a Java project "Foo"
4. Created a type in the default package named "Test" in Java
5. In the Package Explorer drag and drop Test from project "Foo" to project "Java"
6. An error dialog appeared:
Title: Refactoring
Message: An exception has been caught while processing the refactoring 'Move'.
Reason: Resource /Java/Test.java does not exist

The following exception was in the log:

Just noticed the "caused by" exception halfway down the stack trace. I actually forgot to mention a 
step: I had created a few line breakpoints and a method breakpoint in the class before moving it. This 
appears to be the source of the problem.

Fixed.
The starting project was used instead of the destination project in this case.

JavaBreakpointTypeChange - modified to use the right project.
